2018-06-29.abstract: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2018-06-29.snippet: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: SAPIENS: A Brief History of Humankind, by Yuval Noah Harari. (Harper Perennial, $22.99.) Harari, an Israeli historian, delves into humanity’s history, exploring why Homo sapiens — once just one human species among several — dominated. This sweeping account attempts to tell a genetic, cultural and social history, with a particular focus on the roles of cognition and agricultural and scientific advancements in our evolution.
2018-06-29.headline_main: New in Paperback: ‘Sapiens,’ ‘Men Without Women’

2018-06-29.abstract: Rather than becoming partisan instruments of any president, American soldiers have more reason than ever to heed Huntington’s call to neutral public service.
2018-06-29.snippet: Rather than becoming partisan instruments of any president, American soldiers have more reason than ever to heed Huntington’s call to neutral public service.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: In his short time in office, President Trump has surrounded himself with senior military officers and expressed unquestioning admiration for the armed forces, even going so far as to propose a military parade on Veterans Day — something more typical of Beijing or Moscow. Should we be worried?
2018-06-29.headline_main: Should We Worry About Trump’s Fawning Admiration of the Military?

2018-06-29.abstract: In the past you rarely knew where your favorite writers stood on political and social issues. That’s changed.
2018-06-29.snippet: In the past you rarely knew where your favorite writers stood on political and social issues. That’s changed.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: Though it probably gives their publicists heart palpitations, some best-selling novelists are choosing to enter the political fray on social media. J.K. Rowling has long used her Twitter feed to address social and political issues; so has the romance powerhouse Sarah MacLean, who says, “Writing is always political, but now more than ever, it’s important for those of us who have a platform to use it to draw attention to what’s happening in the world.”
2018-06-29.headline_main: As Their Publicists Cringe, Best-Selling Authors Enter the Political Fray

2018-06-29.abstract: The typewritten page, bearing the influential feminist thinker’s intimate thoughts and revisions, reveals the inner workings of an avant-garde mind.
2018-06-29.snippet: The typewritten page, bearing the influential feminist thinker’s intimate thoughts and revisions, reveals the inner workings of an avant-garde mind.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: Simone de Beauvoir, the 20th-century French writer and philosopher, published her foundational feminist text “The Second Sex” in 1949, predating by more than a decade the women’s liberation movement that swept the Western world. An impassioned treatise on the female plight under the oppression of a male-dominated work force, this book — with such prescient and controversial themes as the comparison between gender and racial conflicts among the working class — stirred controversy in Europe and America and solidified her legacy as one of history’s most independent and influential thinkers.
2018-06-29.headline_main: Revisiting Simone de Beauvoir’s ‘The Second Sex’ as a Work in Progress

2018-06-29.snippet: Yoleni’s, a food emporium in the upscale Kolonaki neighborhood, is all about showcasing the gems of Greek gastronomy.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: At first glance, Yoleni’s looks like an Athenian grocery store of a bygone era. You can taste cold cuts, cheeses and halvah before you buy; the feta is sold by the slice from a large slab preserved in salty brine; and there is a bakery and a fruit and vegetable section. But walk a few steps farther in, and you’ll realize this multi-floor food emporium in Kolonaki, an upscale neighborhood of Athens, is all about showcasing the gems of Greek gastronomy.
2018-06-29.headline_main: From Wine to Sweets, Greek Goodies at a New Athens Market

2018-06-29.headline_main: A Warming World Creates Desperate People

2018-06-29.abstract: Those who say that the civil rights movement prevailed because of polite dialogue misunderstand the history of protest.
2018-06-29.snippet: Those who say that the civil rights movement prevailed because of polite dialogue misunderstand the history of protest.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: Recent disruptive protests — from diners at Mexican restaurants in the capital calling the White House adviser Stephen Miller a fascist to protesters in Pittsburgh blocking rush-hour traffic after a police shooting of an unarmed teen — have provoked bipartisan alarm. CNN commentator David Gergen, adviser to every president from Nixon through Clinton, compared the anti-Trump resistance unfavorably to 1960s protests, saying, “The antiwar movement in Vietnam, the civil rights movement in the ’60s and early ’70s, both of those were more civil in tone — even the antiwar movement was more civil in tone, but certainly the civil rights movement, among the people who were protesting.”
2018-06-29.headline_main: White America’s Age-Old, Misguided Obsession With Civility

2018-06-29.abstract: Clear some time to make beef ribs in anticipation of this disjointed holiday week, or gear up for Fourth of July grilling.
2018-06-29.snippet: Clear some time to make beef ribs in anticipation of this disjointed holiday week, or gear up for Fourth of July grilling.
2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: Good morning. I hate to pull out an Andy Rooney impression so early in the morning, but it’s annoying that Independence Day falls in the middle of next week and not on a Monday or a Friday as the founders clearly intended. With a two-day weekend ahead of us, a couple days of work, a day off for the Fourth, and two more days until the next weekend, the next nine days of cooking are going to be disjointed and awkward — except of course for those cats in the academic fields who are enjoying summer break, the retired, the vacationing, the financial wizards who can work anywhere there’s a phone. It’ll be tough to get a rhythm going. See if you can’t clear time to make some beef ribs (above) all the same.
2018-06-29.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2018-06-29.lead_paragraph: Despite being cooped up in their studios, many artists find inspiration in the changing seasons — the sculptor Steven Haulenbeek particularly so. Several years ago, the Chicago-based artist decided not to fight the city’s notorious winter freeze but instead to embrace it, pioneering a version of ice casting on his studio’s snowy roof that produced undulating metal vessels and furniture. For summer, he has turned to a warmer material: sand. Haulenbeek sculpts from a solid block of the silica-based variety — a byproduct of the casting process at the bronze foundry adjacent to his studio — before immersing the shape in tinted resin. One day, in the heat of creation, he seized on the perfect form through which to express the arid beauty of the technique: lamps that resemble flowering desert cacti, radiating light. $8,500, stevenhaulenbeek.com — NANCY HASS
2018-06-29.headline_main: 6 Things T Editors Like Right Now

2018-06-30.abstract: In Sarasota, there is a community surrounding a litany of roadside psychics and more than 100 mediums and spiritual guides. Why?
2018-06-30.snippet: In Sarasota, there is a community surrounding a litany of roadside psychics and more than 100 mediums and spiritual guides. Why?
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: SARASOTA, Fla. — On a recent Sunday, Phyllis Town, 66, and more than 40 congregants rotated in and out of Sunday service at the Sarasota Center of Light, founded 68 years ago as a nondenominational church that wed Christianity and metaphysical spirituality, and where all ministers are mediums, to receive their own individual “vibrational healings.” With Ms. Town seated, Rev. Jim Toole, 60, took a breath, closed his eyes and positioned his hands just above the top of her head.  For about 10 minutes, Reverend Toole moved his hands around Ms. Town’s upper torso and head mere inches from her face, careful not to touch her. As she sat silently, carefully breathing, he explained that he was channeling energy. When Reverend Toole was finished, he softly whispered in Ms. Town’s ear as a grin stretched across her face.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Conjuring Spirits in Florida

2018-06-30.abstract: Roe v. Wade could soon be in serious jeopardy. One way to fight is to share our stories.
2018-06-30.snippet: Roe v. Wade could soon be in serious jeopardy. One way to fight is to share our stories.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: Several months ago, I appeared on a morning TV show alongside Cecile Richards, then the president of Planned Parenthood. Our topic had been women’s activism, and we’d both spoken in equal amounts. But when I checked Twitter later, the violent insults were flying only at Ms. Richards, with commenters calling her a “baby butcher” and “this puke bitch” for her support of abortion rights. None took aim at me — and as I read the stream, I felt more cowardly than I can ever remember, as if I were crouched in a foxhole while Ms. Richards took fire for the rest of us.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Let’s Talk About My Abortion (and Yours)

2018-06-30.abstract: People want to be listened to, not just apologized at.
2018-06-30.snippet: People want to be listened to, not just apologized at.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: As we scroll through the latest apologies in our news feeds (I’m sorry if anyone was offended; it was the culture back then; I’m mostly sorry but not for THAT one), it’s easy to see what apologies are not. But I’ve been thinking a lot about what apologies are, and why we make them.
2018-06-30.headline_main: I Did a Terrible Thing. How Can I Apologize?

2018-06-30.abstract: An unlikely reality-show hero has forced the country to confront its rigid ideas of Chinese womanhood.
2018-06-30.snippet: An unlikely reality-show hero has forced the country to confront its rigid ideas of Chinese womanhood.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — For a moment, it looked as if China’s rigid beauty standards were on the brink of being upended — or at least expanded slightly.
2018-06-30.headline_main: The Rise and Fall of China’s ‘Stout,’ ‘Dark’ and ‘Not Pretty’ Pop Star

2018-06-30.abstract: At long last, the Democrats have a candidate with youth, fight and energy — and not Trumpian dragon energy.
2018-06-30.snippet: At long last, the Democrats have a candidate with youth, fight and energy — and not Trumpian dragon energy.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At dawn on the day after the election that rocked her world and her party, working on three hours of sleep, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez walked out of her Bronx apartment building.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Local Girl Makes Good

2018-06-30.abstract: With Joe Crowley out of the running to replace Nancy Pelosi, House Democrats are facing a crisis of fresh blood.
2018-06-30.snippet: With Joe Crowley out of the running to replace Nancy Pelosi, House Democrats are facing a crisis of fresh blood.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: Whatever its larger meaning or impact, Representative Joseph Crowley’s stunning loss to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in last Tuesday’s primary election already has set off one tremor within the Democratic Party: It has thrown House leadership into chaos.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Make Way for Young Democratic Leaders

2018-06-30.abstract: Heaven is the Mobile-Tensaw Delta when its mythical flower is in bloom.
2018-06-30.snippet: Heaven is the Mobile-Tensaw Delta when its mythical flower is in bloom.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: From the middle of its namesake delta, the city of Mobile, Ala., looks like a mythical place: shiny skyscrapers framed by cattails and marsh grass, a city that reaches into a sky so vast it holds all the weather there is — bright sun and cottony clouds and pregnant thunderheads and torrential rain — and all at one time. From the middle of that magnificent delta, Mobile could be Atlantis rising from the sea or the Emerald City of Oz.
2018-06-30.headline_main: The Call of the American Lotus

2018-06-30.abstract: The retiring justice imagined that his personal vision could unify the country. He was wrong.
2018-06-30.snippet: The retiring justice imagined that his personal vision could unify the country. He was wrong.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: In the American republic’s slow transformation into a judicial-executive dyarchy, with a vestigial legislature that lets the major controversies get settled by imperial presidents and jurists, Anthony Kennedy occupied a particularly important role. He was appointed to the Supreme Court at a time when the Republican Party was officially interested in curbing judicial activism and restoring power to the elected branches of government. As the court’s swing vote, though, he instead consolidated the judiciary’s imperial role — taking the expansive powers claimed by judicial liberals in the Warren era and turning them to his own purposes, his own vision of the common good.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Anthony Kennedy’s Imperial Legacy

2018-06-30.abstract: For years immigrants have been dying as a direct result of American policy.
2018-06-30.snippet: For years immigrants have been dying as a direct result of American policy.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: TUCSON — During the three and a half years I worked for the United States Border Patrol, from 2008 to 2012, America’s immigration enforcement never made less sense to me than when I tried to explain it to those most affected by it.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Cages Are Cruel. The Desert Is, Too.

2018-06-30.abstract: Fire up the grill and celebrate July 4 with plant protein.
2018-06-30.snippet: Fire up the grill and celebrate July 4 with plant protein.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: Consider the hamburger as it flips from grill to bun. It came to us, as one legend has it, in a moment of inspiration and exigency at a late-19th-century agricultural fair. It became associated with industrialization, the worker’s fast food, the harried woman’s liberation. “Give mother a night off,” White Castle urged in the 1930s.
2018-06-30.headline_main: There Is Nothing More All-American Than the Veggie Burger

2018-06-30.abstract: The ethics official had said Scott Pruitt’s $50-a-night condo rental appeared to be appropriate. But he later learned that the landlord’s husband was lobbying the agency.
2018-06-30.snippet: The ethics official had said Scott Pruitt’s $50-a-night condo rental appeared to be appropriate. But he later learned that the landlord’s husband was lobbying the agency.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The chief ethics officer of the Environmental Protection Agency — the official whose main job is to help agency staffers obey government ethics laws — has been working behind the scenes to push for a series of independent investigations into possible improprieties by Scott Pruitt, the agency’s administrator, a letter sent this week says.
2018-06-30.headline_main: The E.P.A.’s Ethics Officer Once Defended Pruitt. Then He Urged Investigations.

2018-06-30.abstract: This year’s Canada Day celebration coincides with tariffs imposed on American products. “We really are in a very difficult time,” one expert in Ottawa said.
2018-06-30.snippet: This year’s Canada Day celebration coincides with tariffs imposed on American products. “We really are in a very difficult time,” one expert in Ottawa said.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — This year on Canada Day, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will visit a former Heinz ketchup plant in Ontario and, later Sunday, meet steelworkers in Saskatchewan.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Trade War and Canadian Pride Mix in Retaliatory Tariffs Against U.S.

2018-06-30.abstract: Thousands turned out Saturday to criticize the separation and detention of migrant families who crossed the border together.
2018-06-30.snippet: Thousands turned out Saturday to criticize the separation and detention of migrant families who crossed the border together.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Protesters marched into Lafayette Square opposite the White House on Saturday and chanted “families belong together” to counter President Trump’s “zero tolerance” immigration policy, and were joined in declaring that message by dozens of other rallies from New York to California. While the occupant of the White House was away for the weekend at his Bedminster, N.J., golf club, images of the rallies were broadcast by cable news networks throughout the day.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Protests Across U.S. Call for End to Migrant Family Separations

2018-06-30.abstract: The situation was deteriorating along the border between Syria and Jordan where thousands fled after a new offensive began in the southern city of Dara'a.
2018-06-30.snippet: The situation was deteriorating along the border between Syria and Jordan where thousands fled after a new offensive began in the southern city of Dara'a.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: Thousands of families fleeing a Syrian government offensive in the southern city of Dara’a were stranded at the Jordanian border on Saturday, unable to either return home or escape the violence because passageways to the neighboring country had been sealed.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Syrian Offensive Leaves Thousands Stranded at Jordan’s Closed Border

2018-06-30.abstract: Sam Trabucco’s puzzle hits the gas.
2018-06-30.snippet: Sam Trabucco’s puzzle hits the gas.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE —  If it’s July, then it’s time to hit the road.  I just wish there were a place I could drive to this week with no fireworks, for my scaredy dog’s sake.  Somewhere under Fort Knox might work.  Anyway, Sam Trabucco has designed a puzzle with multiple routes, and what’s more patriotic than letting people go their own way?
2018-06-30.headline_main: Driving Around

2018-06-30.abstract: The appointment of Ronald D. Vitiello as acting director of ICE comes as some activists call for the agency to be abolished.
2018-06-30.snippet: The appointment of Ronald D. Vitiello as acting director of ICE comes as some activists call for the agency to be abolished.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ronald D. Vitiello, a senior Border Patrol official, will serve as acting director of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency, the Trump administration announced on Saturday, in a move that comes amid calls by some activists and politicians for the agency to be abolished.
2018-06-30.headline_main: Top Border Patrol Official to Serve as Acting Director of Immigration and Customs Agency

2018-06-30.abstract: For thousands who left Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria, FEMA’s temporary housing assistance is running out. A federal judge extended their government aid for a few more days.
2018-06-30.snippet: For thousands who left Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria, FEMA’s temporary housing assistance is running out. A federal judge extended their government aid for a few more days.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: KISSIMMEE, Fla. — It was moving day at a Super 8 motel in this city of strip malls, not far from the hubbub of Disney World. Minivans and S.U.V.s lined the parking lot on Saturday, as families in flip-flops packed the few things they had accumulated since fleeing Hurricane Maria nine months ago: a purple folding chair, a hot plate, a hamper full of laundry.
2018-06-30.headline_main: For Puerto Rican Storm Evacuees, Another Moving Day Looms

2018-06-30.snippet: See full results and maps from the Texas special election.
2018-06-30.lead_paragraph: See full results and maps from the Texas special election.
